item.title: Atomic Notes
item.description: Atomic Notes # Atomic notes are single, self-contained notes that capture a single idea or piece of information. They are meant to be read and understood without needing to refer to anything more. They can be connected to another atomic note or idea in some way. By breaking down complex ideas into smaller, atomic notes, one can make their notes more organized and easier to review later. Go back

item.title: Fedora Linux
item.description: Linux distribution developed by the Fedora Project. Originally developed as a continuation of the Red Hat Linux project.

item.title: Micropolitan Statistical Area
item.description: Micropolitan Statistical Area # Micropolitan Statistical Areas are labor market and statistical areas in the United States centered on an urban cluster with a population of at least 10,000 but fewer than 50,000 people. The designation was created in 2003 by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). Micropolitan areas include the county where the urban cluster is and adjacent counties linked by commuting ties. The OMB has identified 543 micropolitan areas in the United States.

item.title: MPV Player
item.description: MPV Player # mpv.conf # volume=50 profile=gpu-hq scale=ewa_lanczossharp cscale=ewa_lanczossharp video-sync=display-resample interpolation tscale=oversample

item.title: Python
item.description: Python # Cheat Sheet # Python terminal: python3 in cmd. Comments: # at the start of any line. Print: print("Stay Safe…) Indentation: must be followed. Examples # Example 1 # num = 5 print(num) returns 5 type(num) <class 'int'> Example 2 # num = 5.0 print(num) returns 5 type(num) <class 'float'> Example 3 # greet = "Hello user" print(greet) returns: 'Hello user' type(greet) <class 'str'> Example 4 # is_available = True print(is_available) returns: True type(is_available) returns: <class 'bool'> Example 5 # num = None print(num) returns: None type(num) returns: <class 'NoType'> Operators # + - * / % ** // = += -= *= /= == !

item.title: Sans-serif
item.description: Sans-serif # In typography and lettering, a sans-serif, sans serif, gothic, or simply sans letterform is one that does not have extending features called “serifs” at the end of strokes. Sans-serif typefaces tend to have less stroke width variation than serif typefaces. They are often used to convey simplicity and modernity or minimalism. Code # font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Nimbus Sans L", Roboto, Noto, "Segoe UI", Arial, Helvetica, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; Read more

item.title: Serif
item.description: Serif # In typography, a serif (/ˈsɛrɪf/) is a small line or stroke regularly attached to the end of a larger stroke in a letter or symbol within a particular font or family of fonts. Code # font-family: Constantia, "Lucida Bright", Lucidabright, "Lucida Serif", Lucida, "DejaVu Serif", "Bitstream Vera Serif", "Liberation Serif", Georgia, serif; Read more

item.description: Controls, Personal Sound Profiles, Tile Tracker support.
